summary: The SEC Whistleblower Reform Act of 2025 aims to strengthen protections for whistleblowers who report violations of securities laws. It expands the definition of 'whistleblower,' clarifies reporting channels, and mandates timely processing of award claims.  The bill also nullifies agreements that waive whistleblower rights or require arbitration.  Essentially, it seeks to improve the effectiveness and fairness of the SEC's whistleblower program.
